Shop Small Saturday
Saturday, November 29, 2025
10:00 AM
3:00 PM
752 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Support local, shop small! Join us for Shop Small Saturday in Downtown Clermont on November 29 from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM!
Stroll through our charming downtown, explore unique shops, and get a head start on your holiday shopping
Check in at the Clermont Main Street tent at the Art Walk — 756 W Montrose Street
Get a FREE GIFT when you shop small and show your support!
Let’s make a big impact by shopping small

July Wine Stroll
Friday, July 18, 2025
5:30 PM
9:30 PM
756 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Rain or shine, come to Downtown Clermont and enjoy sampling a variety of red, white, and rose wines at over 20 participating local businesses.
Wine sampling starts at 6:30pm at each of the 20+ locations. You will receive a map of participating locations at Check-In where you will receive your wine glass and wristband for the evening.

Downtown Clermont Farmers Market
Sunday, July 13, 2025
9:00 AM
2:00 PM
752 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Nestled in the heart of Clermont, the Clermont Farmer’s Market has become a beloved gathering place for those seeking fresh produce, handcrafted goods, and a delightful outing.
As you navigate the market, you will encounter a variety of vendors from all over Central Florida. Explore the vendor booths and shop for locally grown produce, seafood, coffee, irresistible baked goods, and artisanal crafts. Sip, shop and stroll downtown Clermont’s restaurants, shops, breweries, and interesting boutiques.
Learn more
Are you a vendor looking to join our event?
Visit this link.
Vendors & Food Trucks: We NEVER go through an events company or private people to book vendors. You will always deal directly with Clermont Main Street. DO NOT send money or information claiming to be booking vendors or talent for First Friday Food Trucks, the Farmers Market, Harvest Festival, or Hometown Holidays. They are scammers.

4:00 PM
7:00 PM
752 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States

Google Calendar
ICS
Cookies & Cocoa Walk is back in Downtown Clermont!
Join us on Saturday, December 13, from 4:00 PM – 7:00 PM for a sweet stroll through the streets of Clermont, filled with free cookies, hot cocoa, and holiday cheer!
Meet Santa Claus himself and snap a festive photo!
Collect cookies at participating stops
Sip cocoa while enjoying the sights, sounds, and smiles of the season
It’s the perfect family event to kick off the holidays in the heart of Downtown Clermont!

First Friday Food Trucks
Friday, August 1, 2025
5:30 PM
9:00 PM
Clermont Community Center
620 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Gather your family or your friends and head to Clermont for a fabulous evening on the First Friday of each month!
Explore downtown while dining at an array of food trucks offering everything from savory dinners to mouthwatering snacks and heavenly sweets from 5:30 pm to 9 pm!
Discover the charm of downtown as you sip on your favorite beverages and take a leisurely stroll. Discover a variety of vendors showcasing their unique creations and don't miss the chance to shop till you drop at our local retail stores and chic boutiques!
Vendors & Food Trucks: We NEVER go through an events company or private people to book vendors. You will always deal directly with Clermont Main Street. DO NOT send money or information claiming to be booking vendors or talent for First Friday Food Trucks, the Farmers Market, Harvest Festival, or Hometown Holidays. They are scammers.

Get ready, Clermont! It’s time for the Anime Night Market!
Join us on Saturday, September 20, 2025 from 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM for a night full of anime vibes, unique vendors, and cosplay fun!

Downtown Clermont Farmers Market
Sunday, August 3, 2025
9:00 AM
2:00 PM
752 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Nestled in the heart of Clermont, the Clermont Farmer’s Market has become a beloved gathering place for those seeking fresh produce, handcrafted goods, and a delightful outing.
As you navigate the market, you will encounter a variety of vendors from all over Central Florida. Explore the vendor booths and shop for locally grown produce, seafood, coffee, irresistible baked goods, and artisanal crafts. Sip, shop and stroll downtown Clermont’s restaurants, shops, breweries, and interesting boutiques.
Learn more
Are you a vendor looking to join our event?
Visit this link.
Vendors & Food Trucks: We NEVER go through an events company or private people to book vendors. You will always deal directly with Clermont Main Street. DO NOT send money or information claiming to be booking vendors or talent for First Friday Food Trucks, the Farmers Market, Harvest Festival, or Hometown Holidays. They are scammers.

Nestled in the heart of Clermont, the Clermont Farmer’s Market has become a beloved gathering place for those seeking fresh produce, handcrafted goods, and a delightful outing.
As you navigate the market, you will encounter a variety of vendors from all over Central Florida. Explore the vendor booths and shop for locally grown produce, seafood, coffee, irresistible baked goods, and artisanal crafts. Sip, shop and stroll downtown Clermont’s restaurants, shops, breweries, and interesting boutiques.

Rain or shine, come to Downtown Clermont and enjoy sampling a variety of red, white, and rose wines at over 20 participating local businesses.

Real people, real passion.
The projects and events put on by Clermont Main Street are led by dedicated board members, staff, and committee chairs who bring passion, experience, and vision to the organization’s mission. Together, they help foster a vibrant and thriving downtown for residents and visitors alike.
Meet the staff and board members who are behind your favorite downtown elements.
Meet Our
Staff
Natalie Kahler
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
Email:
director@clermontdowntown.com
Natalie began working with Clermont as a State consultant in October 2023 and immediately fell in love with the exceptional downtown.  One of her first jobs was to photograph every building in the downtown, so she spent weeks walking and exploring all Clermont had to offer. “From the beautiful lakes and rolling hills, to pristine historic buildings and well-manicured parks, downtown Clermont makes every place perfect for a photograph. Add to that the wide array of retail and restaurants and you have the recipe for a perfect Main Street community.”  In her new role as Executive Director, Natalie is glad to bring her years of experience in Main Street to help Clermont become an even better version of itself. Her favorite Clermont Main Street program is the art exhibit that will combine greater awareness of Clermont’s fascinating history with the talent of local artists.
Contact
Jennifer Christy
EVENT COORDINATOR
Email:
jennchristy@clermontdowntown.com
Jenn has lived in Clermont since 1995 and has always been involved in the community. Her first job in the area was with the South Lake YMCA and since then she has volunteered with several community organizations.  Her favorite things about Clermont is how people show up to take care of each other - from fundraisers to physical labor, Clermont people get the job done!  She also loves all the lakes and the opportunities they provide. Of all the events she curates for Clermont Main Street, the weekly Farmers Market is her favorite. It’s wonderful “bringing in vendors that have worked really hard on their craft or their recipes and listening to the stories behind their small businesses. My favorite thing to hear at the end of the day is ‘it was a great day at the market.’” She loves that her job gives the community so many things to enjoy - an array of vendors, great brick and mortar businesses, and our beautiful downtown.
Contact
Frankie Saunders
SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER & EVENT ASSISTANT
Email:
rizman289@gmail.com
A proud member of the Clermont community since 2020, Frankie is deeply passionate about the people, the local businesses, and the strong sense of connection that makes Clermont feel like home. Known for his energy, creativity, and community spirit, “The Rizman” has become a familiar face downtown—especially at the weekly Farmers Market, his favorite Clermont Main Street project. Whether supporting small businesses, highlighting local eats, or helping bring events to life, Frankie’s heart is always in building up the town he proudly calls home.  “There’s something special about the way everyone supports one another - it feels genuine.”
Contact
Meet Our
Board
Meghan Brummert
SECRETARY & ORGANIZATION CHAIR
Meghan Brummert moved to Clermont around 2015.  She especially loves Waterfront Park and all of the lakes Clermont has to offer.  When Clermont Main Street successfully wrote a grant to pay for an Historic Structure Survey, Meghan found the information in the almost 1000 page document fascinating.  Learning about the architecture and the stories of Clermont helped her feel even more connected to the community.  “I feel like the role of Clermont Main Street in the preservation and celebration of Clermont’s rich history is incredibly important.”
Beth Merrick
BOARD MEMBER
Beth Merrick has lived in Clermont since 2003 and she loves the connections!  “Everywhere you turn, someone knows someone. I always know who to call, who to ask, who to reach out to. People are willing to jump into action, share, show up, and lend support and care. It’s all about the relationships.” Her favorite Clermont Main Street event is the monthly wine stroll because she has gotten to know the regular participants and volunteers that make it happen.  Beth said feedback is always positive and it’s fun to see people enjoying our beautiful downtown.
Keith Mullins
TREASURER
Keith Mullins has been a resident in Clermont since 1988 and has served on Clermont City Council.  He opened his shop, Bacchus Vino Etcetera, in 2004 and it has become a downtown staple.  He appreciates the people of Clermont and the spirit they bring to their life - individually and collectively. He believes Clermont Main Street  can work as a bridge between government, the merchants, and the residents.  Keith says downtown “can be a powerful agent for positive change.”
Amanda Nethero
BOARD MEMBER
Amanda Nethero has lived in Clermont since 2005. She loves Clermont’s small town feel and charm and all the memories those help her create. Some of her favorite memories include bringing her kiddos downtown during the holidays for the festivals and Christmas parade.  Amanda is passionate about Clermont Main Street’s events.  “I have a special place in my heart for our events. There is nothing better than having a platform that allows us to bring together the community and create lasting memories.”
Jeff Powell
DESIGN CHAIR
Jeff Powell has lived in Clermont his whole life - it is his hometown in fact and in his heart.  “I am proud to contribute to the community that made me, and play a role in shaping its future, while honoring its past.”  Jeff appreciates that Clermont is a tight-knit community where people genuinely care about one another.  And while the city has grown exponentially over the years, that sense of connection remains deeply rooted and continues to define who we are.  Jeff is very partial to the Art Walk, but his favorite Clermont Main Street program is the new streetscape project that will be implemented in Summer 2025.  “I believe it has the potential to elevate the downtown experience to an entirely new level and further strengthen our sense of place.”
Gigi Capria
BOARD MEMBER
Gigi Capria has been involved in Clermont since before Y2K.  An untiring volunteer herself, Gigi loves how many like-minded people she meets that are also willing to give their time make Clermont her best version of herself. Gigi pleaded the fifth when asked to pick a favorite Clermont Main Street project. Why? Because she loves each of them for different reasons.  And if you’ve met Gigi, you believe that to be true. Her infectious enthusiasm for Clermont has helped many individuals and organizations.
Real people, real passion.

Jeff Powell has lived in Clermont his whole life - it is his hometown in fact and in his heart.  “I am proud to contribute to the community that made me, and play a role in shaping its future, while honoring its past.”  Jeff appreciates that Clermont is a tight-knit community where people genuinely care about one another.  And while the city has grown exponentially over the years, that sense of connection remains deeply rooted and continues to define who we are.  Jeff is very partial to the Art Walk, but his favorite Clermont Main Street program is the new streetscape project that will be implemented in Summer 2025.  “I believe it has the potential to elevate the downtown experience to an entirely new level and further strengthen our sense of place.”
Gigi Capria
BOARD MEMBER
Gigi Capria has been involved in Clermont since before Y2K.  An untiring volunteer herself, Gigi loves how many like-minded people she meets that are also willing to give their time make Clermont her best version of herself. Gigi pleaded the fifth when asked to pick a favorite Clermont Main Street project. Why? Because she loves each of them for different reasons.  And if you’ve met Gigi, you believe that to be true. Her infectious enthusiasm for Clermont has helped many individuals and organizations.

Nestled in the heart of Clermont, the Clermont Farmer’s Market has become a beloved gathering place for those seeking fresh produce, handcrafted goods, and a delightful outing.
As you navigate the market, you will encounter a variety of vendors from all over Central Florida. Explore the vendor booths and shop for locally grown produce, seafood, coffee, irresistible baked goods, and artisanal crafts. About Us
We Are Clermont Main Street
Clermont Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit driven by Downtown Clermont business owners, local entrepreneurs, and residents who believe in the power of investing in the city’s historic core. Guided by the nationally recognized Four-Point Approach to revitalization—Organization, Promotion, Design, and Economic Vitality—the program works to cultivate a thriving, connected, and resilient downtown. Its efforts are made possible through a blend of public funding, grants, memberships, sponsorships, and proceeds from community events that bring Downtown Clermont to life.
Our Mission
Clermont Main Street's mission is to bring Clermont together through active community engagement that revitalizes our historic downtown. We aim to celebrate our history, foster innovation and creativity, and grow our local economy for the benefit and enjoyment of residents and visitors alike.
Main Street Programs
Explained
Why Being a Main Street Matters
By being part of the Florida Main Street program, Downtown Clermont gains access to tools, support, and recognition that benefit the entire community:
Creates jobs
: A revitalized district attracts new businesses and strengthens the job market.
Saves tax dollars
: A strong downtown tax base helps protect and improve existing community investments.
Preserves history
: Economic health supports the upkeep and protection of historic buildings.
Builds community pride
: Main Street serves as a shared public space that fosters connection and partnership.
The 4-Point Approach
We utilize the
Main Street 4-Point Approach
to work towards the revitalization of Clermont. This approach is made up of four committees with the following goals:
Organization
: Creating a strong foundation for sustainable revitalization through partnerships, community involvement, and resource development.
Promotion
: Positioning downtown as the center of community life and economic activity, while promoting a positive image and unique identity.
Design
: Enhancing the physical and visual character of downtown through thoughtful design and preservation.
Economic Vitality
: Strengthening and growing the district’s economy through market-based business development strategies.
Florida Main Street
Florida Main Street
is a technical assistance program aimed at revitalizing historic downtowns and encouraging economic development while preserving historic character.
Established in 1985, the program supports over 40 communities across Florida through a network affiliated with the
National Main Street Center
.
Florida Main Street is administered by the Division of Historical Resources under the Florida Department of State and follows the Main Street Four-Point Approach®.
Discover Downtown Clermont
Downtown Clermont is a Florida Main Street district and part of a network of 1,200 Main Street America communities. And while the city will continue to be the energetic and inclusive Choice of Champions, Downtown Clermont is now unveiling its own unique brand and identity within the city.
We’re excited to introduce the new Downtown Clermont brand which brings back “Gem of the Hills” and unites it with Downtown’s other intrinsic feature, “Lure of the Lake.” It’s symbolic of old versus new…and authentic to the history that makes this destination within Clermont so special. But don’t take our word for it…come on Downtown and see for yourself.
Awards & Recognition
Secretary of State names Clermont Florida Main Street Program of the Month, August 2022
World Atlas Best Downtowns in Florida
25 Years of Tree City USA
DEP Designated Outstanding Florida Waters

Downtown Clermont Farmers Market
Sunday, August 10, 2025
9:00 AM
2:00 PM
752 West Montrose Street
Clermont, FL, 34711
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Nestled in the heart of Clermont, the Clermont Farmer’s Market has become a beloved gathering place for those seeking fresh produce, handcrafted goods, and a delightful outing.
As you navigate the market, you will encounter a variety of vendors from all over Central Florida. Explore the vendor booths and shop for locally grown produce, seafood, coffee, irresistible baked goods, and artisanal crafts. Sip, shop and stroll downtown Clermont’s restaurants, shops, breweries, and interesting boutiques.
Learn more
Are you a vendor looking to join our event?
Visit this link.
Vendors & Food Trucks: We NEVER go through an events company or private people to book vendors. You will always deal directly with Clermont Main Street. DO NOT send money or information claiming to be booking vendors or talent for First Friday Food Trucks, the Farmers Market, Harvest Festival, or Hometown Holidays. They are scammers.

About Us
We Are Clermont Main Street
Clermont Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit driven by Downtown Clermont business owners, local entrepreneurs, and residents who believe in the power of investing in the city’s historic core. Guided by the nationally recognized Four-Point Approach to revitalization—Organization, Promotion, Design, and Economic Vitality—the program works to cultivate a thriving, connected, and resilient downtown. Its efforts are made possible through a blend of public funding, grants, memberships, sponsorships, and proceeds from community events that bring Downtown Clermont to life.
Our Mission
Clermont Main Street's mission is to bring Clermont together through active community engagement that revitalizes our historic downtown. We aim to celebrate our history, foster innovation and creativity, and grow our local economy for the benefit and enjoyment of residents and visitors alike.
Main Street Programs
Explained
Why Being a Main Street Matters
By being part of the Florida Main Street program, Downtown Clermont gains access to tools, support, and recognition that benefit the entire community:
Creates jobs
: A revitalized district attracts new businesses and strengthens the job market.
Saves tax dollars
: A strong downtown tax base helps protect and improve existing community investments.
Preserves history
: Economic health supports the upkeep and protection of historic buildings.
Builds community pride
: Main Street serves as a shared public space that fosters connection and partnership.
The 4-Point Approach
We utilize the
Main Street 4-Point Approach
to work towards the revitalization of Clermont. This approach is made up of four committees with the following goals:
Organization
: Creating a strong foundation for sustainable revitalization through partnerships, community involvement, and resource development.
Promotion
: Positioning downtown as the center of community life and economic activity, while promoting a positive image and unique identity.
Design
: Enhancing the physical and visual character of downtown through thoughtful design and preservation.
Economic Vitality
: Strengthening and growing the district’s economy through market-based business development strategies.
Florida Main Street
Florida Main Street
is a technical assistance program aimed at revitalizing historic downtowns and encouraging economic development while preserving historic character.
Established in 1985, the program supports over 40 communities across Florida through a network affiliated with the
National Main Street Center
.
Florida Main Street is administered by the Division of Historical Resources under the Florida Department of State and follows the Main Street Four-Point Approach®.
Discover Downtown Clermont
Downtown Clermont is a Florida Main Street district and part of a network of 1,200 Main Street America communities. And while the city will continue to be the energetic and inclusive Choice of Champions, Downtown Clermont is now unveiling its own unique brand and identity within the city.
We’re excited to introduce the new Downtown Clermont brand which brings back “Gem of the Hills” and unites it with Downtown’s other intrinsic feature, “Lure of the Lake.” It’s symbolic of old versus new…and authentic to the history that makes this destination within Clermont so special. But don’t take our word for it…come on Downtown and see for yourself.
Awards & Recognition
Secretary of State names Clermont Florida Main Street Program of the Month, August 2022
World Atlas Best Downtowns in Florida
25 Years of Tree City USA
DEP Designated Outstanding Florida Waters
